Description: Pottery money-box(?) or oil-lamp(?). Pale buff slip (may not be intentional) covers the surface in places. Burnishing on lower wall; domed upper body with round central aperture, strongly hipped carination and deep body tapering to flat base; rectangular slot through base and lower wall; two large chips to rim. Red-brown Nile silt with frequent fine-medium mica and fine-coarse lime.
Curator's comments: Ptolemaic(?) parallel from Schedia (Abd El-Fattah 1998, 51-2, fig. 25). Abd El-Fattah, A. 1998. Recent discoveries in Alexandria and the Chora, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 37-53.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.81) (Phase 3)
